ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Sorry, but this course was unbelievably boring.

The six-week course is a great choice for people without background in financial concepts to learn the basics of the financial language. I used what I learned from this course to develop a financial model for the final project of another course.
The course covers a lot of important material in a very short time, perhaps having this split into two professional skills courses?

I appreciate how low drama this course is. It was hard to sit through so muchfinanace lecturing sometimes haha, but doing in-class exercises makes it way more fun. It is also great to have assignments each week and really straightforward expectations
Course spent too much time in the weeds, busy work that wasnt helpful for what many of us will do. Needto spend more time on high level concepts of analysis.

There is way too much (valuable) information crammed into this PSC! I learned a lot of basic financial concepts that I've already found to be very useful/helpful in my work, but I think it would be great to meet twice per week for this course because it is difficult to focus for two hours in the evenings.Assignments were very helpful, though I found myself searching through class slides, reading notes, and online for more information in order to complete the assignments.

This course would have been more engaging if there had been projects or cases that students worked together to solve. The material itself was relatively dry, so being able to problem solve and generate real deliverables would have facilitated more active and enduring learning.
Maureen is great!

Maureen is an excellent teacher. The class was useful and material very helpful, esp for people with nobackground in accounting. Towards the end the class got significantly more difficult and the homework was extremely time consuming for a 1 credit class.The classes were a bit rushed and it was difficult to follow because there was so much information. However, Maureen is v good at explaining things in simple terms. Course would have been a bit more productive not at the end of the semester with finals, etc for full-credit classes.
very valuable class
I think this course could be a semester long course. I would want the class tomove beyond the material covered to include how students might use financial concepts on the job.
Very helpful for FES students

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Both in-class exercises and homework are very well designed to master the knowledge.
The take home assignments.
The in-class and take home assignments helped to remind me of the concepts I was learning and to try them out myself
Her handmade notes, powerpoints = awesomeAlso - she did a cool thing where we had one case study consistent throughout - that was super neat
It taught skills that are useful regardless of your particular area of interest.
Making us go through everything and try it out.
A broad overview for a complicated subject of financial analysis. Clear and concise so it will be useful for people with little accounting background.
It is a great overview of accounting and book keeping.
The handouts were clear and very informative.
great intro to important financial concepts
Math!
Great contemporary examples.
All
the explanations

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Pace. It is somewhat plodding and much more material could be covered in the time allotted.
If there's any way to slow the lectures down that would be great!
Make more relevant to people's interests/needs.
Need more time to absorb the materials. However, I can understand as it is one credit course.
Nothing.
It definitely has some valuable concepts but too much information is jammed into what is a 6-week course. The course credit must be come 3 credit course and taught throughout the semester.
The length of time the class is held.

Too much time was given for completing in-class assignments. I spent a chunk of each class twiddling my thumbs, waiting to proceed. The time should have been shortened and the class let out early if we finished the material for the day before the official ending time.
The lectures were very dry. More facilitated engagement and student accountability would have improved the lectures.
Rushed near the end!
A little less homework.
Maybe increase the number of hours
homework

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: I appreciate Maureen's efforts of getting to know her students. She knew who I was before I asked her a question, which basically had never happened to me before during my time here. The relationship was very effective.
N/A
n/a
N/A but very applied to homeworks

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: As a student of Environmental management it was a great class to take understanding how money works and how we talk about it.

Although I would still rather an accountant or work closely with one, I now have a better grasp of the concepts and can apply them (with some google help and referral to my notes) on a personal or work related project.
Although I am not interested in pursuing a career involving finance, I think skills learned in this course will be useful throughout my career nonetheless.
Very useful. I may have to manage a budget or look at financials at some point and now I'll have the information to do so.
Goal was to round out other management skills with financial component.
It is a very important and useful course. In such a short span the amount you learn is amazing.
It is good to know about accounting in any field and a lot of this can be applied to future work.
Just useful knowledge for life.
important for conservation finance
Must understand the technicalities of money and business.
Not sure I'll use these skills but still useful.
Need to understand financial concepts to better understand the private sector, but also to provide better policies based on those concepts.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I thought it might be useful to dip a toe into unfamiliar waters.
To understand Finance
To gain fundamentals of accounting.
I have no background in Finance, and wanted to have some baseline of knowledge so that I understood general concepts going forward.
To get financial basics.
Gain foundation for financial analysis and management.
Out of the interest to understand how important the financial analysis is in envoronmental management.
my interest in knowing basic concept of financial management

I have no formal background in finance, so this course was a great introduction! Though I am not confident in creating financial spreadsheets, I feel comfortable looking at them and attempting to pick them apart in order to assist decision making.
To gain insight about financial concepts.
As a refresher to an undergraduate course I took on financial accounting and to get a clearer understanding of financial markets.
I felt I needed a foundation in financial concepts to support my summer internship and future job prospects.
financial concepts are important tool
Finance, stacking paper, y'all.
To learn basic accounting skills/get exposure.
I needed that class
i'm going to SOm and wanted a refresher

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Well, I still think finance is BS.
Absolutely yes.
Yes
Yes.

While I don't feel that I have mastered any of the concepts we learned, I am grateful to at least have some familiarity with them. I also now have the materials necessary to refer to, should questions arise in the future.
Not really, Perhaps because I had previously taken Forest Finance I should not have taken this course.
Yes
Yes
No, knowledge/skills fell short of expectations.
Yes
more than expected
Yes.
Yes!
Yes
More or less. I would have preferred more hands on work and greater accountability among the students.
yes.
Yes.
Yes. V helpful.
Yes, it met my expectations
yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Awesome way to work through problems
Learning with other people and helping to explain things to eachother. Highly recommended.
Making sure that we were on the right track on the homework assignments.
n/a
N/A

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Everyone at FES should go through this PSC
Do the in-class and take home homework, have fun with it!
Do it. It is super helpful. I thought I knew most of this stuff but it really reinforced!
Only take it if you are starting from 0.
Work in a group to do the homework.
I would not recommend this course unless you plan be part of detailed accounting analysis for your career. It's a lot of busy work and goes too fast to gain much.
Just give it a try so you will understand better about financial report we usually saw in the news.
good one. go ahead
Take it! It's a great course!
It is a lot of information but the class is worth it.
Be sure that you can stay alert in the evenings. The material can be dry.
do the homework
Just take it.
Def worth taking but kind of time-consuming when you have a lot already going on.
Please take it!
take it
